premise: In recent years, word embeddings (Mikolov et al., 2013; Pennington et al., 2014; Peters et al., 2018; Devlin et al., 2019) have emerged as a commonly used alternative to n-gram matching for capturing word semantics similarity.
hypothesis: Currently Word embeddings are seldom used for capturing word semantics similarity.
label: False
